body.p: When a dataset is divided into two parts including a training dataset. This approach is called:

feedback.p: Incorrect; Please refer to the reading, this term is not correct. What approach involves randomly dividing your dataset into two parts to validate your model?
Correct; This approach is used to estimate the test error.
Incorrect: The LOOCV approach is different from the Validation Set approach as it is not as random.

body.p: LOOCV approach might become computationally expensive to implement, what approach can be used in its place:

feedback.p: Correct: This approach allows you divide the dataset randomly into a set number of groups for validation purposes.
Incorrect: This presents issues when you do a 50% split between your test and training data set.
Incorrect: There is an approach that can be used instead of LOOCV, they are closely related but one divides data into a set number of groups larger than 2.

body.p: Which of the following statements is an advantage of using k=10 versus k=number of observations(n).

multiple_choice.choice: The former requires fitting the model k times versus n times. If you have a million records, this will become expensive to implement.
There is no difference, so there is no advantage of one over the other.
You can not perform CV on multiple methods using k=n.

feedback.p: Correct: This is one of the main advantages.
Incorrect: One requires fitting the model as many times as you have records.
Incorrect: Although it will take a long time, you can perform CV on multiple methods using LOOCV or k-Fold.
